definitions.definition: ( physics ) The physics of light and vision : basic optical science.
examples: a PhD in the optics of liquid crystals

definitions.definition: Technology that makes use of such physics: applied optical science; business lines making use of such technology.
examples: defense R&D investments in both optics and electronics

definitions.definition: The light-related aspects of a device.
examples: the optics of liquid crystals under certain laboratory conditions
The optics of this telescope are particularly good.

definitions.definition: ( figuratively ) Perception , image , public relations , especially in politics .
examples: His policy prescription was sound, but the optics of its discussion were horrible.

main_definition: ( physics ) The physics of light and vision : basic optical science.
secondary_definitions: Technology that makes use of such physics: applied optical science; business lines making use of such technology.
The light-related aspects of a device.
( figuratively ) Perception , image , public relations , especially in politics .
